it in the 
> arc files. It could be useful to add this support.

o you think?

The URI fragment (aka hash) is interpreted by the client and =
is media
type specific. The client-server interaction to retrieve the two
U=
RIs:

a) http://example.org/test#a
b) http://example.org/test#b

is going t=
o be identical. The only difference is in client-side
display/interpretatio=
n of the result. I cannot imagine why it would be
useful to store this data=
, but I can imagine why it would cause
problems. Can you describe some ways=
 in which it might be helpful?

best,
Erik Hetzner
